body_html: I don't have an answer on the second optimization question unfortunately, but if you do want to support more than the standard float and int32 types on mobile, you can recompile TensorFlow with ANDROID_TYPES_FULL defined. This will result in a larger binary though. We're working on improving the documentation around this, and there's some information in this free ebook too: http://www.oreilly.com/data/free/building-mobile-applications-with-tensorflow.csp

body: I don't have an answer on the second optimization question unfortunately, but if you do want to support more than the standard float and int32 types on mobile, you can recompile TensorFlow with __ANDROID_TYPES_FULL__ defined. This will result in a larger binary though. We're working on improving the documentation around this, and there's some information in this free ebook too: http://www.oreilly.com/data/free/building-mobile-applications-with-tensorflow.csp
